metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7872 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The key_gc_unused_keys function in security/keys/gc.c in the Linux kernel through 4.2.6 allows local users to cause a denial of service (OOPS) via crafted keyctl commands. Dmitry Vyukov discovered that the Linux kernel's keyring handler attempted to garbage collect incompletely instantiated keys. A local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7872` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-70-generic - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-lowlatency - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-3.13.0-70-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-70.113
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-70-generic - 3.13.0-70.113
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-55-generic - 3.16.0-55.74~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support kamal> Per the oss-security discussion and the author's commit notes, 911b79cde is not actually a security issue, so removed its break-fix.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-70.113').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
